name: treatment of used vegetable cooking oil by anaerobic digestion | biogas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14770/documentation

This multi-output activity produces biogas and digestate from used vegetable oil. The methane content of the biogas is calculated depending on the substrate input.

Input of used edible oil to incoming storage at the biogas plant. 

The treatment includes storage (and 10% of the total pre-treatment storage emissions) of the substrates, anerobic fermentation, as well as the storage after fermentation. The activity ends with the biogas and digestate being available at the biogas plant. Furthermore, the calorific value of the biogas only accounts for the methane content excluding the H2S content in it.The storage of the substrate before the AD process is assumed to be an open air system which has higher emission factors than an under cover system. Finally, the dataset incorporates emissions of CO2 and CH4 due to the storage of the substrate before the AD process. NH3 and N2O emissions to air from the substrate storage are considered irrelevant since the substrate itself does not have a respective nitrogen content. Emissions from the storage of the digestate are not included in this dataset.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Conditions refer to biogas production in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The storage of the substrate before the anaerobic digestion process is considered to be open-air.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data for this dataset was generated within a project in 2009-2011 financed by the Swiss Federal Office for Energy in order to analyse the life cycle of Swiss agricultural biogas production in centralised and decentralised plants. The data used for modelling were taken from a survey of 18 biogas plants in Switzerland and literature. Assumptions were validated with biogas experts. 7 new reference biogas production systems have been established based on the questionnaires, comprising the fermentation of manure, manure with different ratios of co-substrate addition and 3 sizes of biogas plants (small = 2E5 m3, medium = 6E5 m3, large = 14E5 m3).

exchanges.description: calculated by multypling the followings: mass of substrate (kg of wet mass) x DM of substrate (kg of DM per kg wet mass) x OM of substrate (kg of OM per kg of DM) x biogas potential (m3 of biogas per kg of OM). The result yields m3 of biogas

exchanges.description:
Lifespan is taken as being equal to 20 years.In order to take account of the scale effect, the following formula is applied: 
Ui = U0 x (Ci/C0)^0,7 
where Ui is the number of infrastructure units for the reference case i, in “units”; U0 = 1 [unit] is the number of infrastructure units for the reference facility "anaerobic digestion plant, agriculture, with methane recovery"; Ci is the annual biogas production for the reference case i, en m3/year; C0 = 350,000 [m3/year] is the annual biogas production of the reference facility "anaerobic digestion plant, agriculture, with methane recovery". 
The infrastructure input per kg of substrate is calculated according to the following formula: 
Ii = Ui x Yi / (20 x Ci) 
where Ii is the infrastructure input  “anaerobic digestion plant, covered, agriculture” for the reference case i, in  “units” per kg of substrates; 
Ui is the number of infrastructure units for the reference case i, in “units”; 
Yi is the biogas production yield for the reference case i, in m3 of biogas per kg of substrates; Ci is the annual biogas production for the reference case i, in m3/year.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value according to literature: 
ES(CO2) = (44/12) x C(C) x EF4 x t
where ES(CO2) is the carbon dioxide emissions in kg CO2/t of wet substrate;
C(C) is the average carbon content of the substrates in kg C/t of wet substrate; This is calculated to be 735.075 kg of C/t of wet substrate. It is calculated by multiplying the DM of the substrate (0.99% on wet mass basis) with the OM content (0.99% OM on a dry matter basis) and 0.55% which is assumed to be the amount of Carbon (0.75% on the OM basis).
EF4 = 7% is the carbon dioxide emission factor;
t is the percentage of the time that the substrate is stored at the biogas producer’s (0.1, supposed that the substrates are stored at the biogas producer’s for 10% of the stockage time before digestion).

The value includes emissions from the storage of the substrate until its use from the anaerobic digestion process but doesn’t include emissions from the storage of the digestate until its final use. 

Reference:
Dauriat A., Gaillard G., Alig M., Scharfy D., Membrez Y., Bachmann N., Steiner R., Charles R., Maltas A., Sinaj S., Analyse de cycle de vie de la production centralisée et décentralisée de biogaz en exploitations agricoles : Rapport final. Hrsg. Station de recherche Agroscope Reckenholz-Tänikon ART & Station de recherche Agroscope Changins-Wädenswil ACW, Zürich et Nyon. Avril, 2012, 1-147 S.
